text: Ditrigona regularis is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Warren in 1922. It is found in India (Assam) and Burma. The wingspan is 15-17.5 mm for males and 16.5–19 mm for females. The fore- and hindwings are brownish white with reddish brown fasciae., 1968: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae). The Transactions of the Zoological Society of London Volume 31, Issue 4; Abstract: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1922 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Ditrigona regularis
